@graph.name: Vegan Jambalaya with Beans - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: This vegan jambalaya with beans and vegetables is the ultimate comfort food from the South! It's super easy to make, so delicious and packed with proteins!

@graph.headline: Vegan Jambalaya with Beans

@graph.name: Vegan Jambalaya
@graph.description: This vegan jambalaya with beans and vegetables is the ultimate comfort food from the South! It's super easy to make, so delicious and packed with proteins!
recipeIngredient: 1  red bell pepper, cut into medium-sized chunks
2  vegan andouille sausages, roughly chopped ((you could also use vegan Italian or Mexican sausages instead))
3 cups leftover cooked parboiled rice ((=1.5 cups uncooked rice) )

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, heat some oil and sauté the red onion for about 2-3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Then add the bell pepper, the celery, and the vegan sausage. Cook for another 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, heat some oil and sauté the red onion for about 2-3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another minute. Then add the bell pepper, the celery, and the vegan sausage. Cook for another 3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the cooked rice, the kidney beans, the crushed tomatoes, the spices, the soy sauce, and the Tabasco and cook for about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the cooked rice, the kidney beans, the crushed tomatoes, the spices, the soy sauce, and the Tabasco and cook for about 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Season with salt and cayenne pepper and stir in the green onions and the chopped parsley.
recipeInstructions.name: Season with salt and cayenne pepper and stir in the green onions and the chopped parsley.
